Standard_Text:
Explain and demonstrate connections between
music and societal, cultural, and historical
contexts when creating, performing, and
responding.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Musicians connect societal, cultural, and historical contexts when creating, performing, and responding.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Relate Artistic Ideas and Works with Societal, Cultural, and Historical Context to Deepen Understanding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Explain and demonstrate how personal interests,
knowledge, and ideas relate to choices and intent
when creating, performing, and responding to
music.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Musicians connect their personal interests, experiences, ideas, and knowledge to creating, performing, and
responding.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Synthesize and Relate Knowledge and Personal Experiences to Make Art
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Connecting
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Select from teacher-provided criteria to evaluate
musical works or performances.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
The personal evaluation of musical work(s) and performance(s) is informed by analysis, interpretation, and
established criteria.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Apply Criteria to Evaluate Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Describe a personal interpretation of how creators’
and performers’ application of the elements of
music and expressive qualities, within genres and
cultural and historical context, convey expressive
intent.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Through their use of elements and structures of music, creators and performers provide clues to their expressive
intent.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Interpret Intent and Meaning in Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Identify the context of music from a variety of
genres, cultures, and historical periods.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Describe how the elements of music and
expressive qualities relate to the structure of the
pieces.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Response to music is informed by analyzing context (social, cultural, and historical) and how creators and
performers manipulate the elements of music.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Select music to listen to and explain the
connections to specific interests or experiences for
a specific purpose.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Individuals’ selection of musical works is influenced by their interests, experiences, understandings, and purposes.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Perceive and Analyze Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Responding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Demonstrate performance decorum and
audience etiquette appropriate for venue and
purpose.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Perform the music, alone or with others, with
technical accuracy to convey the creator’s intent.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Musicians judge performance based on criteria that vary across time, place, and cultures. The context and how a
work is presented influence audience response.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Convey Meaning Through the Presentation of Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Identify and apply teacher-provided criteria (such
as correct interpretation of notation, technical
accuracy, originality, and interest) to rehearse,
refine, and determine when a piece is ready to
perform.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
To express their musical ideas, musicians analyze, evaluate, and refine their performance over time through
openness to new ideas, persistence, and the application of appropriate criteria.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Develop and Refine Artistic Techniques and Work for Presentation
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Perform a selected piece of music demonstrating
how interpretations of the elements of music and
the expressive qualities (such as articulation/style
and phrasing) convey intent.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Performers make interpretive decisions based on their understanding of context and expressive intent.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Identify how personal, social, cultural, and
historical context inform performances.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
When analyzing selected music, read and
identify by name or function standard symbols for
rhythm, pitch, articulation, and dynamics.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Explain how understanding the structure and the
elements of music are used in music selected for
performance.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Analyzing creators’ context and how they manipulate elements of music provides insight into their intent and
informs performance.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Apply teacher-provided criteria for selecting music
to perform for a specific purpose and/or context
and explain why each was chosen.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Performers’ interest in and knowledge of musical works, understanding of their own technical skill, and the context for a performance influence the selection of repertoire.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Select, Analyze, and Interpret Artistic Work for Presentation
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Performing
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Present the final version of documented personal
composition or arrangement, using craftsmanship
and originality to demonstrate an effective
beginning, middle, and ending, and convey
expressive intent.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Musicians’ presentation of creative work is the culmination of a process of creation and communication.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Describe the rationale for making revisions
to the music based on evaluation criteria and
feedback from their teacher.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Evaluate personal work, applying teacher-provided criteria, such as application of selected
elements of music and use of sound sources.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Musicians evaluate and refine their work through openness to new ideas, persistence, and the application of
appropriate criteria.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Refine and Complete Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Use standard and/or iconic notation and/
or audio/video recording to document personal
simple rhythmic phrases, melodic phrases, and
two-chord harmonic musical ideas.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Select, organize, construct, and document
personal musical ideas for arrangements
and compositions within AB or ABA form that
demonstrate an effective beginning, middle, and
ending, and convey expressive intent.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Musicians’ creative choices are influenced by their expertise, context, and expressive intent.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Organize and Develop Artistic Ideas and Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Generate simple rhythmic, melodic, and harmonic
phrases within AB and ABA forms that convey
expressive intent.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: The creative ideas, concepts, and feelings that influence musicians’ work emerge from a variety of sources.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Generate and Conceptualize Artistic Ideas and Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Creating
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Connect and demonstrate
the relationships between
music and societal, cultural,
and historical contexts when
creating, performing, and
responding.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Relate Artistic Ideas and Works with Societal, Cultural, and Historical Context to Deepen Understanding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Connect and demonstrate
how personal interests,
knowledge, and skills relate
to choices and intent when
creating, performing, and
responding to music.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Synthesize and Relate Knowledge and Personal Experiences to Make Art
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Connecting
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Develop and apply teacher provided and established
criteria based on personal
preference, analysis, and
context (personal, social,
and cultural) to evaluate
individual and small group
musical selections.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Apply Criteria to Evaluate Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Explain and support
possible interpretations
of the expressive intent
and meaning of musical
selections, citing as evidence
the treatment of the
elements of music, context
(personal, social, and
cultural), (when applicable)
the setting of the text, and
outside sources.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Interpret Intent and Meaning in Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Compare passages in
musical selections and
explain how the elements of
music and context (social,
cultural, or historical) inform
the response.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Apply criteria to select
music for specified purposes,
supporting choices by citing
characteristics found in
the music and connections
to interest, purpose, and
context (social, cultural, and
historical).
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Perceive and Analyze Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Responding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Perform with expression
and technical accuracy,
in individual and small
group performances, a
varied repertoire of music
that includes melodies,
improvisations, and chordal
accompaniments in a variety
of patterns, demonstrating
sensitivity to the audience
and an understanding of the
context (social, cultural, or
historical).
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Convey Meaning Through the Presentation of Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Develop and apply criteria
to critique individual and
small group performances
of a varied repertoire of
music that includes melodies,
improvisations, and
chordal accompaniments
in a variety of patterns, and
create rehearsal strategies
to address performance
challenges and refine the
performances.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Develop and Refine Artistic Techniques and Work for Presentation
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Describe in interpretations
the context (social, cultural,
or historical) and expressive
intent in a varied repertoire
of music selected for
performance that includes
melodies, improvisations, and
chordal accompaniments in
a variety of patterns.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Identify and describe
important theoretical and
structural characteristics
and context (social,
cultural, or historical) in a
varied repertoire of music
that includes melodies,
improvisations, and chordal
accompaniments in a variety
of patterns.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Explain the criteria used
when selecting a varied
repertoire of music for
individual or small group
performances that include
melodies, improvisations, and
chordal accompaniments in
a variety of patterns.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Select, Analyze, and Interpret Artistic Work for Presentation
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Performing
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Perform final versions of
improvisations, compositions,
and three-or-more
chord accompaniments
in a variety of patterns,
demonstrating technical
skill in applying principles of
composition/improvisation
and originality in developing
and organizing musical ideas.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Develop and apply criteria
to critique, improve, and
refine drafts of improvisations,
compositions and three or more chord accompaniments
in a variety of patterns.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Refine and Complete Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Select, develop, and use
standard notation and audio/
video recording to document
melodic, rhythmic, and
harmonic ideas for drafts of
improvisations, compositions,
and three-or-more chord
accompaniments in a variety
of patterns.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Organize and Develop Artistic Ideas and Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Generate melodic, rhythmic,
and harmonic ideas for
improvisations, compositions,
and three-or-more chord
accompaniments in a variety
of patterns.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Generate and Conceptualize Artistic Ideas and Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Creating
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Relate Artistic Ideas and Works with Societal, Cultural, and Historical Context to Deepen Understanding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Synthesize and Relate Knowledge and Personal Experiences to Make Art. Generate a collection
of ideas reflecting
current interests and
concerns that could
be investigated in
artmaking.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Connecting
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Apply Criteria to Evaluate Artistic Work. Develop and apply
relevant criteria to
evaluate a work of art.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Interpret Intent and Meaning in Artistic Work. Interpret art by
distinguishing between
relevant and irrelevant
contextual information
and analyzing subject
matter, characteristics
of form and structure,
and use of media to
identify ideas and
mood conveyed.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Analyze ways that
visual components and
cultural associations
suggested by images
influence ideas,
emotions, and actions.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Identify and interpret
works of art or design
that reveal how people
live around the world
and what they value.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Perceive and Analyze Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Responding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Assess, explain, and
provide evidence of
how museums or
other venues reflect
history and values of
a community and/or
culture.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Individually or
collaboratively, develop
a visual plan for
displaying works of art,
analyzing exhibit space,
the needs of the viewer,
and the layout of the
exhibit.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Analyze similarities and
differences associated with
preserving and presenting
two-dimensional, three-dimensional, and digital
artwork.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Presenting
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Refine and Complete Artistic Work. Reflect on whether
personal artwork
conveys the intended
meaning and revise
accordingly
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Design or redesign
objects, places, or
systems that meet the
identified needs of
diverse users.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Explain environmental
implications of
conservation, care,
and clean-up of arts
materials, tools, and
equipment.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Demonstrate openness
in trying new ideas,
materials, methods, and
approaches in making
works of art and design.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Organize and Develop Artistic Ideas and Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Formulate an artistic
investigation of
personally relevant
content for creating art.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Combine concepts
collaboratively to
generate innovative
ideas for creating art.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Generate and Conceptualize Artistic Ideas and Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Creating
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Analyze and interact
appropriately with
media arts tools
and environments,
considering copyright,
ethics, media literacy
and social media.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Research and show
how media artworks
and ideas relate to
personal life, and social,
community, and cultural
situations, such as
personal identity, history,
and entertainment.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Relate Artistic Ideas and Works with Societal, Cultural, and Historical
Context to Deepen Understanding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Explain and show
how media artworks
form new meanings,
situations, and cultural
experiences, such as
historical events.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Access, evaluate,
and use internal and
external resources, such
as knowledge, interests,
and research, to create
media artworks.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Synthesize and Relate Knowledge and Personal Experiences to Make Art
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Connecting
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Determine and apply
specific criteria to
evaluate various media
artworks and production
processes, considering
context, and practicing
constructive feedback.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Apply Criteria to Evaluate Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Analyze the intent of
a variety of media
artworks, using given
criteria.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Interpret Intent and Meaning in Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Identify, describe, and
analyze how various
forms, methods, and
styles in media artworks
manage audience
experience.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Identify, describe, and
analyze how message
and meaning are
created by components
in media artworks.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Perceive and Analyze Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Responding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Analyze various
presentation formats,
defined processes, and
results to improve the
presentation of media
artworks.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Convey Meaning Through the Presentation of Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Develop a variety of
creative and innovative
abilities, such as testing
constraints in tool usage,
in developing solutions
within and through
media arts productions.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Develop a variety
of artistic, design,
technical, and
soft skills, such as
invention, formal
technique, production,
self-initiative, and
problem-solving,
through performing
various assigned roles
in producing media
artworks.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Develop and Refine Artistic Techniques and Work for Presentation
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Demonstrate and
rationalize how
integrating multiple
contents and forms,
such as media,
narratives and
performance, can
support a central idea
in a media artwork.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Select, Analyze, and Interpret Artistic Work for Presentation
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Producing
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Appraise how
elements and
components can be
altered for intentional
effects and audience,
and refine media
artworks to reflect
purpose and audience.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Experiment with
multiple approaches
to produce content
and components for
determined purpose
and meaning in media
arts productions,
utilizing a range of
associated aesthetic
principles, such as point
of view and perspective.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Refine and Complete Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Organize, propose,
and evaluate artistic
ideas, plans, prototypes,
and/or production
processes for media
arts productions,
considering purposeful
intent.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Organize and Develop Artistic Ideas and Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Envision original ideas
and innovations for
media artworks using
personal experiences
and/or the work of
others.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Generate and Conceptualize Artistic Ideas and Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Creating
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Interpret and show
how the movement
and qualities of a
dance communicate its
cultural, historical, and/
or community purpose
or meaning.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Relate Artistic Ideas and Works with Societal, Cultural, and Historical Context to Deepen Understanding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Conduct research
using a variety of
resources to find
information about a
social issue of great
interest. Use the
information to create
a dance study that
expresses a specific
point of view on the
topic. Discuss whether
the experience of
creating and sharing
the dance reinforces
personal views or offers
new knowledge and
perspectives.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Observe
the movement
characteristics or
qualities observed in
a specific dance genre.
Describe differences
and similarities about
what was observed
to one’s attitudes and
movement preferences.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Synthesize and Relate Knowledge and Personal Experiences to Make Art
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Connecting
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Discuss the
characteristics and
artistic intent of a
dance from a genre,
style, or cultural
movement practice and
develop artistic criteria
to critique the dance
using genre-specific
dance terminology.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Apply Criteria to Evaluate Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Explain how the artistic
expression of a dance
is achieved through
the elements of dance,
use of body, dance
technique, dance
structure, and context.
Explain how these
communicate the intent
of the dance using
genre-specific dance
terminology.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Interpret Intent and Meaning in Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Explain how the
elements of dance are
used in a variety of
dance genres, styles,
or cultural movement
practices. Use
genre-specific dance
terminology
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Describe or
demonstrate recurring
patterns of movement
and their relationships
in a dance.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Perceive and Analyze Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Responding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Compare and
contrast a variety of
possible production
elements that would
intensify and heighten
the artistic intent of the
work. Select choices
and explain reasons
for the decisions made
using production
terminology.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Recognize needs and
adapt movements to
performance area. Use
performance etiquette
and performance
practices during
class, rehearsal, and
performance. After
the performance,
accept notes from
choreographer and
make corrections as
needed and apply to
future performances.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Convey Meaning Through the Presentation of Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Collaborate as an
ensemble to refine
dances by identifying
what works and does
not work in executing
complex patterns,
sequences, and
formations. Solve
movement problems
to dances by testing
options and finding
good results. Document
self-improvements over
time.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Apply basic
anatomical knowledge,
proprioceptive feedback,
spatial awareness,
and nutrition to
promote safe and
healthful strategies
when warming up and
dancing.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Embody technical
dance skills (e.g.,
alignment, coordination,
balance, core support,
clarity of movement)
to accurately execute
changes of direction,
levels, facings, pathways,
elevations and landings,
extensions of limbs, and
movement transitions.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Develop and Refine Artistic Techniques and Work for Presentation
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Use the internal
body force created by
varying tension within
one’s musculature for
movement initiation
and dynamic expression.
Distinguish between
bound and free flowing
movements and
appropriately apply
them to dance phrases.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Use combinations of
sudden and sustained
timing as it relates to
both the time and the
dynamics of a phrase or
dance work. Accurately
use accented and
unaccented beats in a
variety of meters.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Refine partner and
ensemble skills in the
ability to determine
distance and spatial
design. Establish
diverse pathways, levels,
and patterns in space.
Maintain focus with
partner or group in near
and far space.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Select, Analyze, and Interpret Artistic Work for Presentation
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Performing
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: n/a
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Revise dance
compositions using
collaboratively
developed artistic
criteria. Document
the revisions. Explain
reasons for revisions
and how choices made
relate to artistic criteria.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Refine and Complete Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Determine artistic
criteria to choreograph
a dance study that
communicates personal
or cultural meaning.
Based on the criteria,
evaluate why some
movements are more
or less effective than
others.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Explore
choreographic devices
and dance structures to
develop a dance study
that supports an artistic
intent. Explain the goal
or purpose of the dance.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Organize and Develop Artistic Ideas and Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Explore various
movement vocabularies
to transfer ideas into
choreography.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Relate similar or
contrasting ideas to
develop choreography
using a variety of stimuli
(e.g., music, observed
dance, literary forms,
notation, natural
phenomena, personal
experience/recall,
current news or social
events).
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Generate and Conceptualize Artistic Ideas and Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Creating
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Investigate the time
period and place of a
drama/theatre work
to better understand
performance and
design choices.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Research and
analyze two different
versions of the same
drama/theatre story to
determine differences
and similarities in the
visual and aural world
of each story.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Explore the ethical
responsibilities to
oneself and others
when recording, posting,
and sharing through
the internet, social
media, and other
communication formats.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Identify universal
themes or common
social issues and
express them through a
drama/theatre work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Relate Artistic Ideas and Works with Societal, Cultural, and Historical Context to Deepen Understanding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Explain how the actions
and motivations of
characters in a drama/
theatre work impact
perspectives of a
community or culture.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Synthesize and Relate Knowledge and Personal Experiences to Make Art
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Connecting
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Identify the technical
theatre elements used
in a drama/theatre
work to justify aesthetic
choices.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Identify a specific
audience or purpose for
a drama/theatre work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Use supporting
evidence and criteria to
evaluate drama/theatre
work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Apply Criteria to Evaluate Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Identify personal
aesthetics, preferences,
and beliefs through
participation in or
observation of drama/
theatre work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Identify cultural
contexts that may
influence the evaluation
of a drama/theatre work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Explain how artists
make choices based on
personal experience in
a drama/theatre work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Interpret Intent and Meaning in Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Describe and record
personal reactions to
artistic choices in a
drama/theatre work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Perceive and Analyze Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Responding
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Adapt a piece of
literature and present it
for an audience.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Convey Meaning Through the Presentation of Artistic Work
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Articulate how
technical theatre
elements are integrated
into a drama/theatre
work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
Recognize how
acting exercises and
techniques can be
applied to a drama/
theatre work.
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text: Develop and Refine Artistic Techniques and Work for Presentation
Subject: Arts (2019-)

Standard_Text:
